author: Aditya Bharadwaj
K V
text:
The National Investigation Agency (NIA) claimed on Friday that the prime accused in the Church Street blast case, Alam Jeb Afridi alias Jaweed Rafeeq, had confessed to having planted the bomb on December 28, 2014 and that the target was an Israeli delegation expected to visit the Coconut Grove restaurant, outside which the explosion took place.

However, Bengaluru police officials who probed the case as well as Israeli consulate officials denied any knowledge of such a delegation or its plans to visit the restaurant.

A press release from the NIA said the suspect, declared an absconder by the NIA, was living here as Jaweed Rafeeq, an AC mechanic for the past three years and got married last year.

Afridi also ‘confessed’ to an arson attack on the Israeli Visa Facilitation Centre here in November last year.
title: Target was an Israeli delegation, says accused
